coRdon 0.99.5

Subset codonTable object.

subset.Rd

Subset codonTable object.

# S3 method for codonTable
subset(x, subset, ...)

Arguments

x

A codonTable object to be subset.
subset

A logical or character vector indicating which elements of x to keep. If logical, subset should be of length length(x). If character, subset should contain at least some of the elements of either getKO(x) or getCOG(x).
...

further arguments to be passed to or from other methods.

Value

subsets of codonTable object, keeping in each slot only those elements that meet the criteria in subset.

Examples

# create codonTable
mat <- matrix(sample(1:10, 610, replace = TRUE), nrow = 10)
cT <- codonTable(mat) # produces informative warning
#> Assigned alphabetically sorted codons as column names.
cT
#> codonTable instance with codon counts from 10 sequences.
#>    length AAA AAC AAG AAT ACA ACC ACG ACT AGA AGC AGG AGT ATA ATC ATG ATT CAA
#> 1     357  10   9  10   4   1   2   8   7   8   9   9   1   6   3   5   8   4

subset(cT, c(rep(c(TRUE,FALSE), 5))) # subset odd sequences

cT <- setKO(cT, rep(c("K00001", "K00002"), 5))
subset(cT, "K00001")
